results.title: No other way
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World Is Ours”.
The history of the International Labor Organization since World War I. Illustrates two main aspects of its work: the improvement of labor conditions (exemplified by the Maritime labor conventions) and the improvement of living standards. Points out that poverty anwhere is a threat to prosperity everywhere. Shows activities in Libya, where the ILO has helped train workers for new UN assisted industries. Narrated by James McKechnie.

results.title: Towards the full life
results.creator_credit: Anthony de Lotbinière, Norman Swallow and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of “The World is ours” series
A UNESCO experiment in the Nile Valley where in a few years, by improving agricultural methods and hygiene, and encouraging education, enormous advances have been made in the living standards of Egyptian villagers. A centre was established in the Nile delta for technical and general education which attracted students from all over the Middle East and became the nerve centre of great changes.

results.title: The Forgotten indians
results.creator_credit: Anthony de Lotbinière and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World Is Ours”.
A study of the work of the Andean Indian Mission of the United Nations in the Peruvian highlands showing how education, agricultural methods and living standards are being improved. Commentary written by Paul Rotha and narrated by Colin Wills.

results.title: Weather forecast
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World Is Ours”.
International cooperation in weather forecasting. Radio communications system controlled by the World Meteorological Organisation of the United Nations. Numerous examples of how weather forecasting can reduce or eliminate the danger and damage of hurricanes, gales and high tides. Weather studies in the reclamation of desert areas.

results.title: People without a land
results.creator_credit: Stephen Segaller and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Looks at Israel’s apparent campaign to take over Palestine, not with arms but by building huge settlements all over the occupied West Bank and offering accommodation at heavily subsidised prices to Jewish settlers. Allegations are made that Israel plans to drive Arabs out of occupied territories. Includes interviews with Palestinian farmers who have lost some of their land, Israeli Ministers and neutral commentators.

results.title: Strangers in their own land
results.creator_credit: Chris Curling and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Examines Aboriginal land rights in the Weipa area of Northern Queensland, presenting both sides of the conflict between the Comalco bauxite miners and the Aboriginal people.

Episode of Series “World in action”.

results.title: The Last refuge
results.creator_credit: Michael Beckham and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Examines Paraguay under the Stroessner regime emphasising the regime’s corruption, use of torture and repression, and asylum for some of the world’s most wanted men. Exposes a number of personalities including ex-Nazi Adolf Mengele.

Episode of Series “World in action”.

results.title: VD: don't take the risk
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”
Statistics show that venereal disease rates are rising, particularly among teenagers; teenagers explain how they become affected, and later describe their experiences in clinics. A lecture, sensibly frank and usefully informative in respect to symptoms, is heard and discussed by a mixed sixth form; a doctor gives further information about the spread of the disease and clinical procedure.
Follow-up to previous Granada program “The Shadow of ignorance: an inquiry”.
results.description:

results.title: The Life and death of Steve Biko
results.creator_credit: Michael Ryan, Malcolm Clarke and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Biko was the founder of the black people’s convention in South Africa which was working towards the abolition of apartheid. After his death in September 1977 whilst in legal custody, his widow and movement leaders claimed he was murdered by the police. Suitable for upper secondary level.
